case.title: The Case of the Crooked Consensus
case.shortDescription: A controversial DAO governance proposal regarding a major protocol upgrade shows highly suspicious voting patterns, suggesting manipulation.  The upgrade would significantly impact token value.

victim.name: Aavegotchi DAO
victim.background: Decentralized Autonomous Organization governing the Aavegotchi metaverse
victim.avaxRole: Governance of Aavegotchi protocol and treasury

suspects.name: KrakenWhale
suspects.background: A large Aavegotchi token holder with a history of market manipulation in other DAOs
suspects.possibleMotive: Profiting from price manipulation after upgrade announcement

suspects.name: PixelPusher
suspects.background: The author of the controversial governance proposal, a known proponent of radical protocol changes
suspects.possibleMotive: Personal gain through a backdoor deal with a competing protocol
suspects.avaxConnection: Aavegotchi core developer, significant influence on DAO decisions

suspects.name: RivalRealm
suspects.background: A competing metaverse protocol aiming to disrupt Aavegotchi's market dominance
suspects.possibleMotive: Undermining Aavegotchi through sabotage, causing instability and driving users to their platform
suspects.avaxConnection: Competitor in the same metaverse niche, actively attracting Aavegotchi users

suspects.name: FlashTrader
suspects.background: A known insider trader with access to sensitive information concerning Aavegotchi protocol upgrades
suspects.possibleMotive: Profiting from advance knowledge of the upgrade's impact on token price
suspects.avaxConnection: Works at a firm that provides liquidity to Aavegotchi's DeFi contracts

educationalLinks.briefExplanation: Financial services without banks. Like having a bank that runs automatically without human managers.

clues.description: An unusually high number of votes came from addresses known to be associated with KrakenWhale, all cast just before the voting deadline.
Analysis of on-chain transactions reveals PixelPusher received a significant amount of GHST tokens from an unknown wallet just before the proposal launch.
Blockchain forensics shows a large transfer of GHST tokens from accounts linked to RivalRealm, to a series of newly created accounts that then voted against the upgrade.

educationalLinks.briefExplanation: Self-executing contracts with terms written in code. Like a digital vending machine - you put money in, get the product out automatically.

clues.description: FlashTrader's trading history shows suspiciously high-volume GHST trades before and immediately after the voting outcome, indicating insider knowledge of the result.
clues.avaxConcept: Trading volume analysis, insider trading detection

clues.description: A hidden message within PixelPusher's proposal code, discovered only through advanced decompilation, reveals a coded message linking to RivalRealm's servers.

educationalLinks.briefExplanation: Self-executing contracts with terms written in code. Like a digital vending machine - you put money in, get the product out automatically.

solution.motive: Personal gain through a secret agreement with RivalRealm
solution.explanation: While KrakenWhale, RivalRealm, and FlashTrader all exhibited suspicious activity, the combination of the hidden message in the proposal code (Clue 5), the unexplained GHST transfer to PixelPusher before proposal launch (Clue 2), and the high degree of influence PixelPusher held within the DAO conclusively points to him as the culprit. He sabotaged the proposal to benefit RivalRealm, receiving funds in exchange for undermining Aavegotchi's development.

educationalGoals: Analyzing on-chain data for detecting malicious activity

You MUST produce a fully coherent case where story, suspects, clues, and solution logically connect. Each clue must help narrow suspects toward the final culprit; each suspect's background and motive must align with the shortDescription and solution.

Output STRICT JSON only (no markdown, no commentary). Use this exact schema:
{

  "title": string,
  "shortDescription": string,
  "victim": { "name": string, "age": number, "background": string, "avaxRole": string },
  "suspects": [ { "id": number, "name": string, "age": number, "background": string, "possibleMotive": string, "avaxConnection": string } ],
  "clues": [ { "id": number, "description": string, "avaxConcept": string, "difficulty": "easy"|"medium"|"hard" } ],
  "solution": { "culprit": string, "motive": string, "explanation": string },
  "educationalGoals": string[],
  "difficultyLevel": "beginner"|"intermediate"|"advanced"
}

Constraints:
- Tailor suspects and clues to the exact incident described.
- Ensure the culprit is among suspects; clues justify the conclusion.
- Difficulty is advanced.
